title: Zootropolis 2 Sets New Hollywood Animated Box Office Record
summary: Zootropolis 2 has achieved a significant milestone by becoming Hollywood's highest-grossing animated film of all time, with global box office earnings of $1.7 billion. This surpasses the previous record held by Inside Out 2, which made $1.69 billion in 2024. The film, a sequel to the 2016 hit Zootropolis, features returning characters like rabbit police officer Judy Hopps and fox con artist Nick Wilde, who investigate a new reptilian resident. Released in November with a $150 million budget, it had the biggest opening weekend for an animated film and was the fastest to reach $1 billion globally. However, it ranks as the ninth most successful film overall in box office history, behind major titles like Avatar and Avengers: Endgame. Notably, the highest-grossing animated movie worldwide remains China's Ne Zha 2, which earned $2.2 billion last year. Disney executives credited the film's success to enthusiastic fans and the creative team behind it.
